trans-unit.source: Defines a common set of properties for the several display modes that a Web Parts page can enter.
A Web Parts page can enter several different display modes.
In each display mode, certain elements of the Web Parts user interface (UI) are either hidden or displayed, and certain kinds of user modifications to a page are either enabled or disabled.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control contains the implementation for the display modes that are available in the Web Parts control set, and manages the display modes for a page.
The following table lists fields that represent the available display modes.

|Display mode|Description| |------------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.BrowseDisplayMode>|Displays Web Parts controls and UI elements in the normal mode in which end users view a page.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.DesignDisplayMode>|Displays zone UI elements and enables users to drag Web Parts controls to change the layout of a page.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.EditDisplayMode>|Displays special editing UI elements and enables end users to edit the controls on a page.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.CatalogDisplayMode>|Displays special catalog UI elements and enables end users to add and remove page controls.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.ConnectDisplayMode>|Displays special connections UI elements and enables end users to connect Web Parts controls.|
Initializes a value for the name of the display mode.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode> object is never created because the class is abstract.

At run time, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode> class as the base class to create objects for each of the various page display modes.
The name of the display mode.
The name parameter is .
Gets a value that determines whether users can change the layout of a Web Parts page when the page is in a certain display mode.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if users can change the page layout; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether a certain display mode is associated with a class that derives from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ToolZone"></xref> class.

When a Web Parts page enters a display mode whose AssociatedWithToolZone property is set to `true`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control interprets that to mean that an associated class derives from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ToolZone> class, and that additional user interface (UI) elements need to be displayed.
For example, when a page enters edit mode, special zones that contain UI elements for editing Web Parts controls appear on the page.
This behavior is made possible because the AssociatedWithToolZone property value on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.EditDisplayMode> field is set to `true`.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the display mode is associated with a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ToolZone"></xref> class; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether users can personalize a page while the page is in a certain display mode.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager"></xref> control instance on the current page.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if users can personalize a page; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.

However, when <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayMode.RequiresPersonalization*> is set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, and personalization is disabled on the page, the default will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the name of a display mode.
A string that contains the name of a display mode.
Gets a value that indicates whether a particular display mode requires personalization to be enabled.
A Boolean value that indicates whether personalization is required.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets a value that indicates whether controls that have their <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.Hidden*> property set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> should be displayed.
A Boolean value that indicates whether hidden controls should be displayed.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
